de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.spatialmodel.core

Class SpatialModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.core.ExtensionModule
      • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.spatialmodel.core.SpatialModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, XMLStreamable

    public class SpatialModel
extends ExtensionModule
    This class implements Spatial Model

    Patches:

    Version 1.2 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org), Marco Fiore (fiore@tlc.polito.it) on 08/24/2005:
         Added a set of cluster of obstacles that control the density of roads within each cluster. The set of clusters span the movement area.

    Version 1.3 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org) on 09/24/2005:
         Added Methods that returns current allowed movements and particular GDF codes for intersection management.

    Version 1.4 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org) on 11/16/2005:
         Added Canu's ability to display user-defined graphs. The original CANU Mobisim is not able to display a simulation where a spatial model is not used

    Version 1.5 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org) on 11/17/2005:
         Added Methods to manage vehicles' statistics in intersections.

    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    1.0-1.1 Illya Stepanov, 1.2 Marco Fiore, 1.2-1.5 Jerome Haerri

      Separated roadElements disabled

      Vertex - edge mapping Key: V1_ID:V2_ID, Value: associated edge

      Edge - spatial model element mapping Key: Edge, Value: parent SpatialModelElement object

      Spatial Model elements
      protected boolean externalGraph
      Semaphore to enable Graph-based (non-spatialModel-based) visualization
      The original CANU Mobisim is not able to display a simulation where a spatial model is not used (in the case of user-defined Graphs).

      Graph of the movement area

      • clusters

        protected java.util.ArrayList clusters
        Cluster of obstacles elements A cluster in the Spatial Model may be a downtown cluster, or a suburban cluster. This determines the density and the type of roads implemented by the Spatial Model in that cluster. The clusters span the Simulation area.
        Since:
        1.2

        Returns:

      • allowedMovements

        public java.util.ArrayList allowedMovements(Node me,
                                            Edge whereIam,
                                            Vertex whichJunctionIamreaching)
        Considers the type of vehicule, and the roadElement where the vehicule is and the Junction it will reach, and returns an array of allowed movements.
        For example, due to the car type, or traffic signs, the car could not turn on a particular roadElement. This method should be used by the Dijikstra Algorithm when computing the shortest path. By default, we can admit that all movements are permitted.
        Parameters:
        me - the node corrently moving
        whereIam - The edge on which the node is currently moving
        whichJunctionIamreaching - The junction the node is about to reach
        Returns:
        java.util.ArrayList the list of all possible vertices which the node can reach
        Since:
        1.3

      • getNextIntersection

        public Point getNextIntersection(Edge edge)
        Returns the Point element that is the next intersection based on the actual edge and the directional flow
        Parameters:
        edge - on which the node is currently moving
        Returns:
        de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.spatialmodel.geometry.Point Next Intersection
        Since:
        1.3

      • allowedMovements

        public int allowedMovements(Node me,
                            Edge whereIam,
                            Vertex whichJunctionIamreaching,
                            Vertex whereIwantToGo)
        Considers the type of vehicule, and the roadElement where the vehicule is and the Junction it will reach, to know if the requested movement to a new RoadElement is allowed. Possible return values are listed below: 0 movement forbidden 1 stop and wait (traffic light red) 2 stop and yield (stop sign) 3 reduce speed and yield (yield sign) 4 priority (priority sign) 5 do not stop (traffic light green or yellow) By default, we can admit return 2: stop and yield
        Parameters:
        me - the node corrently moving
        whereIam - The edge on which the node is currently moving
        whichJunctionIamreaching - The junction the node is about to reach
        whereIwantToGo - The junction the node wishes to reach
        Returns:
        int the allowed movement code
        Since:
        1.3

      • act

        public int act()
        Executes the extension.

        The method is called on every simulation timestep.
        Specified by:
        act in class ExtensionModule
        Returns:
        0 - the module should be executed on next timesteps, -1 - the module should not be executed on further timesteps and should be removed from the extensions' list

      • visualizeCollection

        protected static void visualizeCollection(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                          java.util.Collection collection,
                                          java.awt.Color color)
        Visualizes a collection of elements.

        Version 1.5 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org):
             Added new colors depending on the number of lanes and traffic lights
             Rule:
                 - Multi-lane: CYAN
                 - Red traffic light: RED
                 - Green traffic light: GREEN
        Parameters:
        g - graphic context
        collection - collection of elements
        color - color

      • findDirEdge

        public int findDirEdge(Vertex v1,
                       Vertex v2)
        Finds the direction of an edge between two points.
        0 if from v1 to v2 1 if from v2 to v1 -1 if no edge is found
        Parameters:
        v1 - first vertex of the edge
        v2 - second vertex of the edge
        Returns:
        direction of the edge

      • createTrafficSigns

        protected void createTrafficSigns()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructs elements from loaded obstacle features

      • createComplexFeatureElements

        protected void createComplexFeatureElements()

      • setDoubleFlow

        public void setDoubleFlow(boolean value)

      • setTrafficLightName

        public void setTrafficLightName(java.lang.String name)

      • createMultilaneRoads

        protected void createMultilaneRoads()
        Adds multiple lanes per roadElement. Depending on the configuration, it may add multiple lanes on a complete street (from one border to another) or on all roadElement. It is also able to focus on a single directional flow.

      • createDoubleFlowRoads

        public void createDoubleFlowRoads()
        Creates differentiated traffic flows. Physically separates each roadElement for each directional flow.

      • createSecondLayerElements

        public void createSecondLayerElements()
        Constructs complex elements from random data This method creates intersections and roads. It also creates complex traffic signs, such as movement restrictions. It finally create advance features for roads, such as multilanes, or higher class roads.

      • load

        public void load(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes simulation parameters from XML tag.

        Version 1.4 by Jerome Haerri (haerri@ieee.org):
             Used in order to load a user defined graph.
        Specified by:
        load in interface XMLStreamable
        Overrides:
        load in class ExtensionModule
        Parameters:
        element - source tag
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception if parameters are invalid
